result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Corie R Richardson
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)

Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. If the defendant has a passport he is to surrender his passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services. Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key. Court further orders the protective order to be sealed. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

2:19 PM Defendant Corie R Richardson in court, in custody.  Attorney Craig Mastantuono in court for Corie R Richardson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Thurston in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
